intro: Scurrula turbinata, commonly known as the turbinate scurrula, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Scurrula turbinata is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
